clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Non-alcoholic Beer in Cirrhosis
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Multifactorial Intervention (Non-alcoholic Beer, Diet and Exercise) on Endothelial Function, Nutritional Status and Quality of Life in Patients With Cirrhosis

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto Nacional de Ciencias Medicas y Nutricion Salvador Zubiran

clinical_study.source: Instituto Nacional de Ciencias Medicas y Nutricion Salvador Zubiran

brief_summary.textblock: The implementation of nutritional strategies targeting several variables at once could benefit patients with cirrhosis. Non-alcoholic beer has different compounds derived from hops that exert antioxidant, anti-inflammatory and nutritional properties. The aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of diet + exercise and non-alcoholic beer on nutritional status, endothelial function and quality of life in patients with cirrhosis.

primary_outcome.description: improvement in serum markers of endothelial function (v.gr. nitric oxide, NO; prostacyclin, PGI2, etc.)
Improvement in quality of life questionnaire CLDQ (chronic liver disease questionnaire)

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in the heterogeneity of gut Microbiota
primary_outcome.description: Changes in the heterogeneity of fecal microbiota in terms of bacterial diversity will be assessed

arm_group.description: non-alcoholic beer + personalized nutritional therapy + aerobic exercise

intervention.description: Treatment consisted of 330ml non-alcoholic beer per day, plus an individualized dietary program and an exercise program with a pedometer-based bracelet to reach at least 5000 steps/day during 2 + 8 weeks.
Treatment consisted of 330ml of water, plus an individualized dietary program and an exercise program with a pedometer-based bracelet to reach at least 5000 steps/day during 2 + 8 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Liver Cirrhosis of any aetiology (liver biopsy or a combination of clinical and biochemical variables plus evidence of portal hypertension); without decompensation during the past month; serum creatinine <1.5 mg%; able to attend the appointed visits and willing to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe concomitant cardiopulmonary diseases; decompensated type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, insulin use or proliferative diabetic retinopathy; orthopedic or osteomuscular limitations; any type of cancer; primary sclerosing cholangitis and inflammatory bowel disease.
